This distinctive 1D material V 2Se 9 could be used in optoelectronic devices because it can absorb photon energy without being disturbed by phonons. The charge mobility calculation of 1D V 2Se 9 is needed to determine whether there are further applications for the field effect transistors that require a direct band gap and appropriately fast mobility, as with 2D MoS 2.
37, 38 The spin property of this 1D material is also needed to be analyzed in future research. The 1D materials have higher surface-to-volume ratios and no dangling bonds, unlike the 2D materials; therefore, the 1D material V 2Se 9 described in this study seems to be a promising material in nanoelectronics.
